ai-mn144:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ai-mn144:2.1_0: At that time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahācunda were staying on the Vulture Peak.
ai-mn144:3.1_0: Now at that time Venerable Channa was sick, suffering, gravely ill.
ai-mn144:3.2_0: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Sāriputta came out of retreat and went to Venerable Mahācunda.
ai-mn144:3.2_1: and after going, he said this to venerable Mahā Cunda:
ai-mn144:3.3_0: “Come, Reverend Cunda, let’s go to see Venerable Channa and ask about his illness.”
ai-mn144:4.1_0: Then Sāriputta and Mahācunda went to see Channa.
ai-mn144:4.1_1: and after going, they exchanged greetings with him.
ai-mn144:4.2_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side.
ai-mn144:4.3_0: “Can you bear up, reverend Channa? Can you carry on?
ai-mn144:4.3_1: Do those painful feelings decrease and not increase?
ai-mn144:4.3_2: Is it known that they are decreasing and not increasing?”
ai-mn144:5.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, I’m not keeping well, I’m not alright.
ai-mn144:5.1_1: painful feelings greatly increase for me and do not decrease,
ai-mn144:5.1_2: and it is known that they increase and do not decrease,
ai-mn144:5.2_0: like a strong man was drilling into my head with a sharp point.
ai-mn144:5.2_1: In the same way, my winds raged inside my head.

ai-mn144:5.6_0: like a deft butcher or their apprentice was slicing my belly open with a meat cleaver.

ai-mn144:5.9_2: and it is known that they increase and do not decrease,
ai-mn144:5.10_0: Reverend Sāriputta, I will slit my wrists. I don’t wish to live.”
ai-mn144:6.2_0: Venerable Channa, keep going! We want you to keep going.
ai-mn144:6.3_0: If you don’t have any suitable food, we’ll find it for you.
ai-mn144:6.4_0: If you don’t have suitable medicine, we’ll find it for you.
ai-mn144:6.5_0: If you don’t have a capable carer, we’ll find one for you.
ai-mn144:6.7_0: Venerable Channa, keep going! We want you to keep going.”
ai-mn144:7.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, it’s not that I don’t have suitable food,
ai-mn144:7.3_0: It’s not that I don’t have a capable carer;
ai-mn144:7.4_0: Moreover, for a long time now I have served the Teacher with love, not without love.
ai-mn144:7.5_0: For it is proper for a disciple to serve the Teacher with love, not without love.
ai-mn144:7.6_0: You should remember this: ‘The mendicant Channa slit his wrists blamelessly.’”
ai-mn144:8.1_0: “I’d like to ask Venerable Channa about a certain point, if you’d take the time to answer.”
ai-mn144:8.2_0: “Ask, Reverend Sāriputta. When I’ve heard it I’ll know.”
ai-mn144:9.1_0: “Reverend Channa, do you regard the eye, eye consciousness, and things knowable by eye consciousness in this way: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?
ai-mn144:9.6_0: mind, mind consciousness, and things knowable by mind consciousness in this way: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
ai-mn144:9.7_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, I regard the eye, eye consciousness, and things knowable by eye consciousness in this way: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
ai-mn144:9.12_0: mind, mind consciousness, and things knowable by mind consciousness in this way: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self’.”
ai-mn144:10.1_0: “Reverend Channa, what have you seen, what have you directly known in these things that you regard them in this way: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self’?”
ai-mn144:10.6_0: mind, mind consciousness, and things knowable by mind consciousness in this way: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self’?”
ai-mn144:10.7_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, after seeing cessation, after directly knowing cessation in these things I regard them in this way: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self’.”
ai-mn144:10.8_0: I understand that my mind is freed through the ending of ear consciousness ...
ai-mn144:10.12_0: mind, mind consciousness, and things knowable by mind consciousness in this way: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self’.”
ai-mn144:11.1_0: When he said this, Venerable Mahācunda said to Venerable Channa:
ai-mn144:11.2_0: “So, Reverend Channa, you should pay close attention to this instruction of the Buddha whenever you can:
ai-mn144:11.3_0: ‘For the dependent there is agitation. For the independent there’s no agitation.
ai-mn144:11.4_0: When there’s no agitation there is tranquility.
ai-mn144:11.5_0: When there’s tranquility there’s no inclination.
ai-mn144:11.6_0: When there’s no inclination, there’s no coming and going.
ai-mn144:11.7_0: When there’s no coming and going, there’s no passing away and reappearing.
ai-mn144:11.8_0: When there’s no passing away and reappearing there’s no this world or world beyond or between the two.
ai-mn144:11.9_0: Just this is the end of suffering.’”
ai-mn144:11.10_0: And when the venerables Sāriputta and Mahācunda given the venerable Channa, got up from their seat and left.
ai-mn144:12.1_0: Then, not long after Venerable Channa had left, Venerable Channa slit his wrists. Then he made a big sacrifice.
ai-mn144:13.1_0: Then venerable Sāriputta approached the Fortunate One,
ai-mn144:13.1_2: While sitting on one side venerable Sāriputta said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-mn144:13.2_0: “Sir, Venerable Channa has slit his wrists.
ai-mn144:13.3_0: Where have they been reborn in the next life?”
ai-mn144:13.4_0: “Sāriputta, didn’t the mendicant Channa declare his blamelessness to you personally?”
ai-mn144:13.5_0: “Sir, there is a Vajjian village named Pubbavijjhana
ai-mn144:13.6_0: Would you have drinking a family that is good family now?”
ai-mn144:13.7_0: “The mendicant Channa did indeed have such families.
ai-mn144:13.8_0: But this is not enough for me to call someone ‘blameworthy’.
ai-mn144:13.9_0: When someone lays down this body and takes up another body, I call them ‘blameworthy’.
ai-mn144:13.11_0: You should remember this: ‘The mendicant Channa slit his wrists blamelessly.’”
ai-mn144:13.12_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-mn144:13.13_0: Satisfied, Venerable Sāriputta was happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-mn144:13.14_0: The second section on the discourses is finished.
